subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Sunday, 22 April, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Kilmarnock 1-2 Celtic
Celtic wrap up the Premier League title thanks to a stunning linjury time free-kick from Shunsuke Nakamura.



 
Strachan delight after title win
Celtic manager Zombie Strachan is full of praise for his team after sealing a second successive SPL title.



 
Newcastle 0-0 Chelsea
Chelsea fail to close the gap on leaders Man Utd after a poor performance at Newcastle.








GOLF




Jacquelin victory in Asian Open
Raphael Jacquelin of France leads from start to finish to a win the Asian Open by two strokes.



 
Watney surges into two-shot lead
American Nick Watney moves into a two-shot lead after the third round of the New Orleans Classic.



 
Zurich Classic leaderboard
All the latest from the USPGA Tour event in Louisiana.








MOTORSPORT




Victorious Stoner overhauls Rossi
Casey Stoner wins the Turkish MotoGP to claim the overall world championship lead from Valentino Rossi.



 
BMW may offer Heidfeld new deal
Nick Heidfeld's impressive start to the season could go a long way to landing a new deal with BMW Sauber.



 
Nascar honours Virginia victims
Nascar is to honour the 32 victims of the Virginia Tech shooting tragedy at its next three races.








FORMULA ONE




BMW may offer Heidfeld new deal
Nick Heidfeld's impressive start to the season could go a long way to landing a new deal with BMW Sauber.



 
Schumacher vows to answer critics
Ralf Schumacher aims to turn around his season when his Toyota car is "competitive again"



 
Hamilton 'could become best ever'
Lewis Hamilton could go on to become the greatest racing driver of all time, his McLaren boss Martin Whitmarsh says.








ATHLETICS




Lel wins London Marathon thriller
Martin Lel out-sprints his rivals to win the London Marathon for the second time.



 
China's Zhou records landmark win
China's Zhou Chunxiu takes victory in the women's race in the 2007 London Marathon.



 
Weir & Woods land British double
Britain's David Weir and Shelly Woods win the wheelchair races at the London Marathon.








CYCLING




Tour will snub dope-probe riders
Tour de France chief says riders implicated in the Spanish doping scandal will not be welcome at this year's race.



 
Landis lines up return to racing
Floyd Landis will ride in events in the US this summer despite the ongoing doping inquiry into his 2006 Tour de France win.



 
Cavendish claims Belgian success
British cyclist Mark Cavendish held off a world-class field to win the Scheldeprijs Vlaanderen in Belgium.








FUN AND GAMES




Marathon man bucks his ideas up
A Harlequins rugby league fan is running the London Marathon dressed as Buck, the club's mascot.



 
Holloway column
Gary's fiery and he says 'You what?' The bloke says '£500,000 for a midget?'



 
Review of the week
Lionel Messi's wonder goal matches Maradona, while Fletcher feels the heat
